credit_line: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
title: Embroidery Design Commemorating the Marriage of Napoleon I and Marie-Louise
provenance: Ex-collection Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY.
medium: Brush and white gouache on laid paper, coated with resin, joined
description: At center, beneath crown, are two initials- a superimposed N and M encircled by stars and a wreath of roses. At the top are two entwined wreaths - one of laurel, and the other of a chrysanthemum-like flower. Oak sprigs at upper corners;floral sprigs at lower corners. The Napoleonic eagle is at the bottom of the wreath. The Legion of Honor medallion hangs below the eagle.
name: Drawing
